intro_screen.main_subtitle: I like to build stuff occasionally.

section.title: Hello, my name is Ayman!
section.description: Brief information about me and some of my interests.

bio: I am currently a senior studying Software Engineering at the University of Texas at Arlington, who is passionate about problem-solving software development, contributing to innovative projects, and learning from experienced professionals.

I have great interest in numerous types of software development such as machine learning, computer vision, and full-stack development. In my free time, I enjoy spending time outside, reading, thrifting, and hanging out with friends.
Fun Facts: I like cats, I have a twin brother, and my favorite fruits are plums!

section.title: Experience
section.description: Positions, team projects, or organizations I am/have been a part of.

experience_items.title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant
description: Provided one-on-one support to over 50 students during weekly office hours, addressing questions or concerns, and clarifying any doubts related to course content.
Graded assignments and exams promptly, maintaining a 48-hour turnaround time, and provided constructive feedback.
Updated course materials, including lecture notes, problem sets, and exam questions, contributing to an increase in student comprehension and engagement.

section.title: Projects
section.description: Some of my most recent or past favorite creations or work.

project_items.description: A website designed to connect photographers and videographers with clients and provide them an easy booking experience.
An ai agent decision based game that allowed to players to select red and blue marbles while avoiding depleting either pile to 0 marbles on their turn.
An e-portfolio built with React.js that utilizes GitHub API. Designed for public use and easy configuration, the first iteration of my website.
